abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment of
            the Mizoram State Road and Rural Development Project for
            India, which supports the major improvement of capacity as
            well as structural upgrading of the road network in the
            state of Mizoram. The negative environmental impacts will be
            mitigated in the following ways: Massive hill cutting
            affecting the stability of slopes is a key issue. Other
            concerns relate to the damage to the road formation, damage
            to the hillside flora and fauna, and disruption to traffic.
            Based on the geological setting, zoning has been worked out
            and cut slopes recommended. Locations vulnerable to
            landslides have been identified, and at most locations,
            mitigation measures as rock bolting, provision of band
            drains where required, and bio-engineering techniques that
            stabilize vertically cut slopes adopted. To prevent loss of
            biodiversity, physical damage or removal of individual
            plants close to the existing carriageway and on the hillside
            where cutting will occur during construction will be
            minimized. Pipe culverts and barbed wire fencing will
            prevent ecological disturbance. Other mitigations include
            identifying disposal areas for construction debris,
            locations for water harvesting and storage, and traffic
            diversion and timing of activities. Other measures address
            involuntary resettlement, indigenous populations, and income
            restoration. Further volumes focus on major maintenance
            routes, environmental impact assessment, and sectoral
            environmental assessment.
